title: Book cover font
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/cunshang_5958.jpg)

This font can be found on most of the covers of Haruki Murakami’s paperbacks. I am not sure if it’s a font per se, because some repeated letters just don’t match.

Thanks in advance.

 [‹ Need help with logofont](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45817 "Go to previous forum topic") [Font ID – Contemporary sans with sloped A and W?!! ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45773 "Go to next forum topic")
author: mydot2001

comments.content:
I’m afraid you answered your own question when you noticed the variation in identical letters. If ’similar’ is good enough, some of [Rob Leuschke’s](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522/http:/www.typesetit.com/) script fonts have this feel.

- Mike Yanega

This is another example

[http://www.amazon.co.uk/gp/reader/0141029331/ref=sib\_dp\_pt#reader-link](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522/http:/www.amazon.co.uk/gp/reader/0141029331/ref=sib_dp_pt#reader-link)

However I still hope that it’s a typo.

And once again you can see that each letter is unique. Each one of the three letter a’s is different, for example. Rob Leuschke’s [Kolker Brush](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/typesetit/kolker-brush/) shows a lot of similarities to your lettering. Leuschke used to do Hallmark card lettering and he continues doing custom lettering. I’m not saying I think he did the book titles, but someone with a similar brush style did.

- Mike Yanega
Too shame that it’s not a type yet.

It says on the back covers of the UK editions “Calligraphy by [Ruth Rowland](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522/http:/ruthrowland.co.uk/page11.htm)”. She & [Stephen Raw](http://web.archive.org/web/20080906190522/http:/www.stephenraw.com/letterforms/) seem to be the usual suspects for hand lettering like this on UK book jackets.
